definition: to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The gardener shouted abuse at the boy for stealing his peaches.
sentences.chinese: 園丁把偷桃的男孩兒大罵一頓。

sentences.english: You can kvetch all you want about Hugo SAYING that he considers Gaddafi a friend.
sentences.chinese: 你可以大罵雨果查韋斯稱視卡扎菲爲友。

sentences.english: But soon a giant bumped into them, sneezed, and cursed. The horse panicked.

sentences.english: He's too angry to hold on to himself not to scold.

sentences.english: Mr Kamei also appeared, cursed soldiers.

sentences.english: Stanton not only refuses to execute the command and at Lincoln, Lincoln.
sentences.chinese: 史丹頓不僅拒絕執行林肯的命令，而且大罵林肯愚蠢。

definition: lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
